meanings.definition: Covered or smeared with dirt or grime
meanings.sent1: The filthier shirt needed a good wash.
meanings.sent2: The alleyway was getting filthier by the day.
meanings.sent3: The filthier the floor, the more the dog enjoyed rolling on it.
meanings.sent4: Her lies made her conscience feel filthier than a muddy puddle.
meanings.sent5: The filthier the dishes, the more determined she was to clean them.

meanings.sent1: His filthier thoughts troubled him deeply.
meanings.sent2: As the corruption spread, the city became filthier.
meanings.sent3: The filthier the gossip, the more people believed it.
meanings.sent4: The filthier his actions, the more he tried to justify them.
meanings.sent5: The filthier the lies, the harder they were to cover up.

meanings.sent1: The filthier jokes made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The movie was banned due to its filthier scenes.
meanings.sent3: The filthier the language, the more the children giggled.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a filthier place than he cared to admit.
meanings.sent5: The filthier the graffiti, the more it stood out on the wall.
